Topic.Title: Am I the only one whose account got axed?

Posts.EditableText:
I tried to come in the other night and couldn't. That was odd. Later, at home, where I've got my account and PW saved, it wouldn't recognize it. Asked for the password to be sent back to me and it said it wasn't an existing account.

Well, if that's true, who's been posting all those newbie questions?

Anyway, re-registered and am in. But curious if anyone else experienced it. Or was it the moderator finally having enough of me.
Posts.HTML:
I tried to come in the other night and couldn't. That was odd. Later, at home, where I've got my account and PW saved, it wouldn't recognize it. Asked for the password to be sent back to me and it said it wasn't an existing account.

Well, if that's true, who's been posting all those newbie questions?

Anyway, re-registered and am in. But curious if anyone else experienced it. Or was it the moderator finally having enough of me.

Posts.EditableText: Given that the format of the forum changed, maybe that had something to do with it.
Posts.HTML: Given that the format of the forum changed, maybe that had something to do with it.

Posts.EditableText: Previously, the forums accounts were separate from the textadventures accounts. Now that the forums have been integrated, you use your textadventures  one for both. Of course, if you didn't have a textadventures one before (only the forums), then you would need to register to get a TA one.
Posts.HTML: Previously, the forums accounts were separate from the textadventures accounts. Now that the forums have been integrated, you use your textadventures one for both. Of course, if you didn't have a textadventures one before (only the forums), then you would need to register to get a TA one.

Posts.EditableText: Ah. Thanks. I was trying to make sense of the fact that my game-posting account was still up. That explains things, then.
Posts.HTML: Ah. Thanks. I was trying to make sense of the fact that my game-posting account was still up. That explains things, then.
